intro: Licania littoralis var. cuneata, commonly known as the coastal licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or saline soils. This variant is notable for its adaptability to harsh coastal environments and its role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
